<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 14+"
    pfs="Restricted"
>
[Tattletale Orb](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2390)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Cursed" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=274" />
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Scrying" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=141" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 193 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

A _tattletale orb_ is a polished crystal sphere that appears to function as a [_crystal ball_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=253). If those whom you use the orb to scry on roll better than a critical failure on their saving throw, they receive a telepathic message alerting them to the scrying. A success or better at the save allows the target to choose to allow you to scry anyway, knowing they can use an aspect of the orb against you, according to the orb's type. A creature that rolls a critical success on the saving throw also learns your name and location. Once you Activate a _tattletale orb_ or use it to cast one of your scrying spells, it fuses to you. You must succeed at a Will save, using the scrying Will DC of a _crystal ball_ of the orb's type, to use another such device.

 _Tattletale orbs_ come in the same types as _crystal balls_, with the same activations and powers. However, your target must roll a critical failure on the saving throw for the orb to function as normal for that type of _crystal ball_.

</title>

<traits>

</row>

</column>

<title
level="2"
right="Item 15"
pfs=""
>
Tattletale Orb (Selenite)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 193 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** 1

</row>

</column>

---

The target is temporarily immune to the orb's [_see invisibility_](/Spells.aspx?ID=271) for 24 hours and can choose to be invisible to the orb's scrying during that time.

<title
level="2"
right="Item 16"
pfs=""
>
Tattletale Orb (Moonstone)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 193 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** 1

</row>

</column>

---

The target is temporarily immune to the orb's [_mind reading_](/Spells.aspx?ID=194) for 24 hours and can use _mind reading_ against you instead, as if the target used the orb.

<title
level="2"
right="Item 17"
pfs=""
>
Tattletale Orb (Peridot)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 193 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** 1

</row>

</column>

---

The target can send you one [_telepathic demand_](/Spells.aspx?ID=336).

<title
level="2"
right="Item 19"
pfs=""
>
Tattletale Orb (Obsidian)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 193 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** 1

</row>

</column>

---

The target is temporarily immune to the orb's [_true seeing_](/Spells.aspx?ID=344) for 24 hours. During that time, you see a [_false vision_](/Spells.aspx?ID=109) of the target's choice if you scry on the target. Despite being higher level than the spell, you can't [disbelieve](/Rules.aspx?ID=267) this illusion if scrying through the orb.
